column2: NORTH CAROLINA DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: North Carolina

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: Warning: hospital ahead.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Drivers may move forward with caution.

column2: 2. The yield sign means:
column4: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.
column10: Go. The light will soon be red.

column2: 3. This sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead.
column8: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column10: The road will curve to the right.

column2: 4. This warning sign means:
column4: Slow down, drive with caution and watch for children
column6: Watch out for children crossing the street

column2: 5. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column4: that there's a school zone ahead.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: Merging Traffic
column10: All traffic must go straight ahead

column2: 7. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Area reserved for people with disabilities

column2: 8. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must not make a right turn.
column8: they must make a left turn at the intersection.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead; slow down to the indicated speed
column6: The road ahead curves right; slow down to indicated speed
column8: Merge, then slow down to the safe speed indicated
column10: Divided highway begins. Slow down to the safe speed indicated

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ahead

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: Keep right

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column4: No left turn

column2: 13. When making a turn, drivers must _____ their speed.
column4: reduce

column2: 14. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.
column6: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column8: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column10: Come to a complete stop and use your horn to warn the vehicles behind you.

column2: 15. Doing all you can to prevent crashes is called:
column4: Defensive Driving

column2: 16. Drivers should use the horn:
column4: only when necessary, to avoid collisions.
column6: to alert other drivers that they made a mistake.
column10: if a driver is moving slowly, and you want them to drive faster.

column2: 17. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
column4: Arrows

column2: 18. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column4: activate your stop lights.
column8: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.
column10: move to another lane if possible.

column2: 19. Drivers must yield for emergency vehicles:
column4: when they see a flashing red or blue light or hear a siren.

column2: 20. If you refuse to take a chemical test issued by a law enforcement officer, the DMV is required to:
column4: place you on probation.
column6: suspend your driver license for 3 months.
column8: wait for a court decision before taking action.
column10: revoke your driver license for at least 12 months.

column2: 21. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column4: Always.
column8: Before you decrease speed and reach the intersection.

column2: 22. If you missed your exit on a freeway, you should:
column4: None of the above.
column6: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column8: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column10: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.

column2: 23. Alcohol causes:
column4: reduced perception.

column2: 24. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column6: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 25. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: get off the road and check your tires.
column10: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 26. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column4: share the lane with another vehicle.
column6: exceed the posted speed limit when driving on expressways.
column10: ride side-by-side in a single lane.

column2: 27. A broken white line:
column4: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column6: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.
column8: marks the right edge of the roadway.

column2: 28. Double solid yellow lines mean:
column4: passing is not permitted in either direction.
column6: passing is permitted in either direction.
column8: the lane to the right may pass.
column10: the lane to the left may pass.

column2: 29. When entering a highway from an entrance ramp, drivers should:
column4: stop first, then gradually enter traffic.
column6: accelerate to the speed of traffic.
column8: enter slowly to avoid other vehicles.
column10: drive above the speed of traffic to get ahead.

column2: 30. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column4: try to pass close behind.
column6: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.
column8: enter one of the blind spots and wait.

column2: 31. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: only if you have an emergency.
column6: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.
column8: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.
column10: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.

column2: 32. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
column4: defensive driving

column2: 33. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
column6: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.

column2: 34. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Turn on your emergency lights.
column6: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.
column8: Open the side window so you can see.

column2: 35. When driving behind a motorcycle:
column4: allow a following distance of at least 4 motorcycle lengths.
column6: allow a following distance of at least 2 car lengths.
column8: allow at least 2 seconds of following distance.
column10: allow at least 4 seconds of following distance.

column2: 36. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column6: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column8: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column10: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.

column2: 37. A flashing yellow traffic signal means:
column4: Stop and proceed when a green light appears.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.
column10: Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.
